thread.title: NLCS recorded its largest television audience since 2010
thread.title_full: NLCS recorded its largest television audience since 2010

title: NLCS recorded its largest television audience since 2010
text:
New York Mets first baseman Lucas Duda and center fielder Juan Lagares celebrate the 8-3 victory against the Chicago Cubs in game four of the NLCS at Wrigley Field. (Photo: Jerry Lai, USA TODAY Sports)
CONNECT NEW YORK (AP) â€” The NL Championship Series had its largest television audience since 2010 despite lasting just four games.
The New York Mets' sweep of the Chicago Cubs in a matchup of big-market teams averaged 7.9 million viewers on TBS. The network said Thursday that was the most since the six-game Giants-Phillies series five years ago on Fox.
The audience was up 55 percent from last year's four-game ALCS on TBS between the small-market Royals and Orioles.
FOR THE WIN
Look inside the Mets' champagne celebration after their NLCS sweep
